author: John Pike
title: We are grateful to all the warriors bearing this war on their shoulders - address by the President of Ukraine from Avdiivka
text:
We are grateful to all the warriors bearing this war on their shoulders - address by the President of Ukraine from Avdiivka
President of Ukraine
29 December 2023 - 18:02
I wish you health, fellow Ukrainians!
Avdiivka. Our positions. Our guys. Ukraine is defending its own here. Defending our entire nation. Just as on the entire front line. Donetsk region. Kharkiv region. Zaporizhzhia. Kherson region - the left bank. It is hard. It is pain and losses. And these are the people who keep Ukraine alive. Life is being fought for here. And we are grateful to every warrior. To every soldier, sailor, sergeant and officer bearing this war on their shoulders. Thank you all, warriors!
Today in Avdiivka, together with the team, we extended Christmas and New Year greetings to the military. All those who are on the front line. Those who are defending our country. Immense gratitude to all the relatives, to every family of our heroes. And to everyone who helps. Those who work to ensure that our guys at the front have what they need. And to everyone in the world who believes in us and does everything to make Ukraine more powerful.
We remember what is at stake in this war. We are defending our country.
Glory to Ukraine!

por

eleconomista.es
enviado:
____
El rechazo a jornadas, horarios, sueldos o "penosidad" de los trabajos está provocando la "fuga de talento" en la construcción, así como en hostelería y comercio. Ello hace que "no resulte atractivo para muchos jóvenes, lo que agrava la dificultad", sobre todo en un contexto de envejecimiento de la mano de obra, especialmente relevante en actividades que exigen un elevado esfuerzo físico. Las patronales hablan de una carencia de casi 700.000 profesionales. Está por ver si el nuevo reglamento de extranjería propicia la inyección de profesionales

author: JT
title: Jordan condemns Israeli attacks on UNRWA shelter in Gaza
text:
AMMAN — The Ministry of Foreign Affairs condemned on Thursday the continuous and systematic targeting of shelters for displaced Palestinians in the Gaza Strip and United Nations centres.
The latest incident was the assault on a school housing displaced persons in the Nuseirat camp in Gaza on Thursday, which is a violation of international law, the Jordan News Agency, Petra, reported.
The ministry's spokesperson Sufian Qudah reiterated the Kingdom's condemnation and denunciation of these actions and crimes, which violate the rules of international law.
He added that these acts contradict all human and ethical values and represent war crimes that the international community must confront and hold the perpetrators accountable.
Qudah called on the international community to assume responsibility, deter Israel from committing further crimes against civilians, and put an end to its war on the Gaza Strip.
He also emphasised the necessity of forcing Israel to respect international law and called for concerted efforts to stop Israeli aggression on Gaza.
